pages.transcription:
Diary
Edward A Barnes
From, W.H.W.

Wednesday, January 1, 1873.
Mild. With the blessing of God I hope to gain great success this year as a Hymn & Song writer. Mother J + girls unclear all day. Della spent the day with Mrs Gurney. + received a present of a nice Dress.
Thursday, 2
A dark rainy day. High wind all night unclear the unclear Onward, which I think is one of the best I have ever written.
2  Friday, 3.
Weather, cold + stormy. Della had company that spent the night... Mother had a very sick night.

Saturday February 4 1873
Weather mild & pleasant.
Mother better - but hardly able to sit up. Received a characteristic letter from Prof. Blim. His "Sunshine" to be out by the 1st of March

SUNDAY 5
A cold stormy Sabbath for the first of the new year. Felt bad all day. 
Opened my old Bible at random and read:
"Be of good cheer - wait I say on the Lord"
Psalm 27
MONDAY 6
Father at home seeing about his coal. Della began school again as a 3rd Grade scholar
Lillie signed the fly leaf of this Diary for me.

Mr Greg spent the evening with me

TUESDAY, JANUARY 7, 1873
Done some copying and wrote my song "Harvest Time". Della copied for me in the evening 
had company again in the evening.
Mother not feeling much better
WEDNESDAY 8
Weather - bitter cold. 
Della had her new Geography. Sent the following efforts to Mr Bliss.

"Onward"
"Drifting"


THURSDAY 9
Weather - Still very cold. For the want of a better term, I copy this:
FAME
The way to fame is like the way to heaven - through much Tribulation.

FRIDAY JANUARY 10 1873
Weather - Still very cold.

 Copied Harvest Time again. Hope I have got it right now, as I want to send it away next week.
Wish mother felt better & father out of trouble.

SATURDAY 11
Weather - quite pleasant again & moderating fast.
Glad am I. Better satisfied with this weeks work & duties than i did last Saturday night. Dont know what to think of Prof. Abbey

SUNDAY 12
Weather - quite mild

Miss Graves sent me a ticket to the West Side Libary for another year.
My ubscription expires Jan 11th 74

Weather - Damp and Cloudy
Recieved $3.00 from O. P. Bliss.
Glad I am able to help father a little, who came home almost sick, with a hard cold.

Recieved a long letter from Aunt Kissy.


TUESDAY 14
Weather - Dreary. Looked like snow all day, which came at night.
Wrote two letters. Not very fond of sea stories, but find 'The Pilot' rather interesting.
Rained all night.

WEDNESDAY 15
Weather - Mild, but cloudy.
Bad for colds and coughs. Old winter is half gone today and glad am I. Wrote another letter.
Billie had a call from Nellie Clarke.

THURSDAY JANUARY 16 1873
Weather = much colder and rather gloomy. Heard from Aunt Livey. The burning of the First Congregational Church occurred in the evening.
"Thy Will be Done"

FRIDAY 17
Weather - Cold and Stormy

 Had one of my thinking days when I dont feel like doing anything but think, think, think. Recieved a letter. Lillie quite unwell in the evening


SATURDAY 18
Lillie drew me a nice book from the library. Della attended a party at Miss Riffley's.
Wrote a letter
Another week goes by & still not a word from Mr. Abbey

SUNDAY, JANUARY 19,1873.
Weather - Cold and Stormy

Father had company. Committed to memory these passages and Prophecym Chapter 4-7-+

How impressive is their impact.
MONDAY 20
Weather - much milder
Did not feel quite as well as usual. Sent this effort to PP Bliss:
"Harvest Time"
Della borrowed that book for me 'Ethelym's Mistakes"
TUESDAY 21
Weather - we're dry enough after the heavy falls of snow last night. Did not feel well enough to write but finished my library book lucid. A Splendid book.

WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 22 1873
Wrote antr new hymn - "Walking on the shore"
Wrote a letter. God bless Mr. Rockwell for the deed of kindness that he did my father this day

THURSDAY 23
Weather - A furious Snow Storm
Snowed & drifted all day long. The gale blew down the rear walls of our church which did some damage.
A winter's night.
FRIDAY 24
Weather - not very cold but stormy day. Don't expect to get over this cold of mine til Spring comes.
This is my birthday

SATURDAY, JANUARY , 1873
Weather - Much milder
Della borrowed Dickens' Bleak House for me because she did not go to the library
Copied "Watching on the Shore"

SUNDAY 26
Weather - Pleasant, but cold.
Had company at dinner and, in the evening too. How I wish I could spend these Sabbaths as I ought to.

MONDAY 27
weather cold. 
Disappointed in not hearing from Mr Bliss.
Another visit from Mr. Gray
Lillie out to tea and Della had company at home.

TUESDAY, JANUARY 28,1873
Weather - =A cold day, So they say=
This is the last week in January

WEDNESDAY 29
Weather - another cold, stinging day. Got off my two letters at last.

Did not feel very well & went to bed with a re-ocurr headache

THURSDAY 30
Weather - Quite mild
Did some copying. Hope I shall derive some benefit from Beecher's Sermons that Della brought me from the library.

FRIDAY, JANUARY 31, 1873
Weather - Quite pleasant
Mother not very well.
Lillie did some copying for one much interested in Beecher's sermons. its great work.
SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 1
Weather - another snow storm which cleared off very cold.
The girls spent the afternoon and evening at Mrs Winter's four weeks from today is the first of Spring.

SUNDAY 2
Weather - A cold Sabbath.
Wanted to read my sermons but could not - so much company, Managed however to read a chapter and to commit to memory my usual verses as would elsewhere

MONDAY, FEBRUARY 3, 1873
Weather - cold, wet & raining.

 Sent Prof. Bliss the following effort

=Watching from the Shore+

 Hope to hear from that gentleman soon.


TUESDAY 4
Weather - pleasant but cold.

  For the want of a better item I quote=

=The excesses of youth are drafts upon old age. Payable with interest about thirty years after date" Colton

WEDNESDAY 5
Weather - Clear & pleasant
Wrote more new effort = 

Song for the Spring
Received a letter, but not from the scource that I expected.

THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 6, 1873
Weather - mild and very pleasant.
Copied and altered the effort I wrote yesterday. Another book from the Library. "Melbank"
Father recieved a letter from Uncle Augustus.

FRIDAY 7
Weather - pleasant a flurry o snow which cleared off very cold.
Spent a portion of the day reading "Millbank"
Had over [unreadable] at company in the evening

SATURDAY 8
Weather= cold & rather stormy

 Copied my song again.
       Recieved my expected letter from Prof. H. which I answered at once.

SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 9, 
Weather - a pleasant Sabbath.
Had our usual company to dinner. Spent the Holy Sabbath, not as I wanted to, 
but as circumstances bade one to do.

MONDAY 10
Weather - mild, but cloudy. 

This is the Anniversary of Fathers and Mothers wedding day.

Next Friday is St Valentines Day.

TUESDAY 11
Weather - A very pleasant day.
Wrote two letters and finished "Milbank" which is a first-rate story.
Did not hear from Mr. Bliss as I expected to

WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 12, 1873.
Weather - Cloudy and cold.

Recieved a kind letter from Mr Bliss. No more efforts for him at least for a spell.

Think I shall go on and write just the same.

THURSDAY 13
Weather - another cold disagreeable day. 
Della spent the evening at the house of a young friend.
Valentines Day tomorrow.

FRIDAY 14
Weather - Mild but cloudy.
Another book from the library 'Dora Deane' Della had eight valentines.
Got the idea of another hymn in my head.

SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 15, 1873
Weather - not very pleasant.
Got off my two business letters, recieved a call from Miss Riffly. Della had company in the evening.
Father brought our new carving knife and fork.

SUNDAY 16
Weather - Quite pleasant, not withstanding a cold, raw wind. 
Had our usual company to dinner & spent the day in my usual manner.
Della did not go to Sunday school.

MONDAY 17
Weather - a beautiful day.
Seems like Spring.
Finished the book of Joshua & wrote my new effort:
"Our Refuge"

TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 18, 1873
Weather - Another beautiful day.
Recieved two letters. Mr. Whitney sent me his "Musical Guest"
also 100 specimen pages. That contained my hymn "Wandering Home"

WEDNESDAY 19
Weather - Still very pleasant.
Did some copying. Papa came home very early to supper
which is quite unusual for him.

THURSDAY 20
Weather - Dark and Cloudy with a snowstorm in the afternoon
Wrote to Mr Abbey

FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1873
Weather - a cold day
Had company to dinner.
Sent to Prof. Abbey this old song of mine, "The Dying Girl"

SATURDAY 22
Weather - bitter cold.
Washington's birth-day.
Re-copied my hymn "Our Refuge" & wrote my new song "Our Jessie" or; "The angels are calling".

SUNDAY 23
Weather - a cold wintery Sabbath.

Had out usual company - both to dinner & in the evening.

Della absent from Sunday School.

MONDAY, FEBRUARY 24, 1873.
Weather - clear and cold.
Della had her photograph taken, don't think they are very good.
Saturday is the first day of Spring,
Suppose we will have our usual snow-storm.

TUESDAY 25
Weather - Pleasant but cold winds.
Finished my library book at last. Thing it was a good story. 
Della took a long walk on business for papa.

WEDNESDAY 26
Weather - another snow storm.
Wrote a long letter to Mr Bliss
which I hope will get me another 
chance to write.
High wind a night.

THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 27, 1873
Weather - a cold morning.
Another fall of snow, with more sleighing.
Commenced 'A brave lady' which Della borrowed for me.

FRIDAY 28
Weather - mild & pleasant.
Wrote to Cousin Emeline.
Mr Grey gave me two large maps & a nice ink stand.
He spent the evening with us.
SATURDAY, MARCH 1
Weather - quite mild, with a flurry of snow towards night.
Finished 'A brave lady' The story is good but think I could have to it in half the words.

SUNDAY, MARCH 2, 1873.
Weather - a stormy Sabbath.
Had our usual company and spent the day as I generally do.
"In your patience possess ye your souls"

MONDAY 3
A cold day.

Papa recieved a Pittsfield paper from Uncle Augustus.

Lillie going to the theatre tomorrow night.
TUESDAY 4
Weather - Bright & Clear.
Recieved a letter of introduction from Mr Bliss to Mr Murray, Andover, Mass.
Wrote to him at once.

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 5, 1873
Weather - a pleasant day.
Sent my letter to Mr Murray  & wrote to Mr Perkins. Hope to recieve 
favourable answers to them both in due seasons.

THURSDAY 6
Weather - another beautiful day. Finished 'Edna Browning' - a good book.
Father brought home The Railroad Scrap Book & also a card of hymns

FRIDAY 7
Weather - wet & rainy with March winds.
Wrote to Uncle Augustus

SATURDAY, MARCH 8, 1873
Weather - very pleasant
Suffered all day with a sore tooth.
Della had a call from Matie Reed in the afternoon

SUNDAY 9
Weather - Storm & sunshine the order of the day.
Father & Lillie on the sick list
A visit from Mr Grey as usual

MONDAY 10
Weather - Bright & clear.
Recieved 2 Pittsfield Papers from Cousin Erin.
Got a book from the library

TUESDAY, MARCH 11, 1873
Weather - pleasant with March winds.
Recieved a letter from Mr Perkins, who gives me another chance to write.
May I improve it in the right sense of the word.
WEDNESDAY 12
Weather - another beautiful day. Did some copying.
Had quite a fire right across the way from us. 
Lillie had a call from Nellie Clark
THURSDAY 13
Weather - Still very pleasant
Sent Mr. Perkins these efforts:
'Watching on the Shore'
'Song for the Spring'
How glad I am for this chance to write again.

FRIDAY, MARCH 14, 1873
Weather - Mild but cloudy.
2 murderers meet their doom today.
Recieved a call from Mr Horton

SATURDAY 15
Weather - A Spring day with high March winds.
Della had another call from Matie Reed

SUNDAY 16
A Spring Sabbath. Mild and pleasant.
Recieved the "Sunshine" from Mrs Bliss & 2 papers from Miss Ripley

MONDAY, MARCH 17, 1873.
Weather - very pleasant.
Mr Hollton took supper with us. Had more company
than we expected in the evening.
St Patrick's Day
TUESDAY 18
Weather - Still very pleasant.

Received a letter from Mr Perkins

who wants to know my price per effort.
The evening mail brought me a good letter from Cousin
Emeline.
WEDNESDAY 19
Weather - cloudy with a slight fall of rain
Wrote my new effort -
"Our Golden Song"
Lillie did some shopping

THURSDAY, MARCH 20, 1873
Weather - More snow.
Wrote to Mr. Abbey & Mr Perkins.
Went to the "Old Folks" concert. Della
went with me.
FRIDAY 21
Weather - pleasant but high winds
Another call from Mr Horton.
Received a letter from Mr Murray.
SATURDAY 22
Weather - pleasant, Copied my new hymn "Our Golden Song" Mr Wriley treated to oysters for supper. Papa had three pittsfield papers from Uncle Augustus.

SUNDAY, MARCH 23, 1873
Weather - a pleasant Sabbath
Had Mr Wiley, Mr Grey & Mr Horton to dinner

Committed to memory a portion of the Sunday School lesson for today

Genesis 28-10-22
MONDAY 24
Weather - rather stormy.

Received a kind letter from Aunt Kittie. Read same & thought a great deal more.

Snow in the evening.
TUESDAY 25
Weather - a regular mid-winters snow storm.
Received a letter from Mr Bliss - what a good man he is!
A wild winters night

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 26, 1873
Weather - More snow. & more sleighing. Della took the part of 'Little Mary' in Ten Nights in a "Balloon" at the Washingtonian home.
Mr Horton gave her $3.00 for her services
THURSDAY 27
Weather - Bright & Clear
Wrote my new hymn 'Long of Praise'
Next Tuesday is the 1st of April
FRIDAY 28
Weather - Dark & somewhat rainy,
Della bought her new shoes with her own money.
Another book from the library

SATURDAY, MARCH 29, 1873.
Weather - quite pleasant
Copied & altered my new effort - "Song of Praise"
Lillie bought her bridal dress. Mr Grey spent the evening with us
SUNDAY 30
Weather - a rainy afternoon
Had our usual company.
Found it quite difficult to preform my devotions.
Miss Ripley sent me a "Christian Union"
MONDAY 31
Weather - mild & pleasant
Heard from Abbey - more promises. Cannot help
but like him for the popularity he is giving my songs

TUESDAY, APRIL 1, 1873.
Weather - a stormy day - snow & rain

Copied my hymn once more. Mr Trilej took supper with us

WEDNESDAY 2
Weather - pleasant

Father recieved another Pittsfield Paper from Uncle Augustus

Got another book from the library
THURSDAY 3
A spring day 
Heard from Mr Perkins - one piece accepted.
Sent for the "Silver Song"

FRIDAY, APRIL 4, 1873
Weather - pleasant & warm

Sent my letter to Cousin Em, & bought Lillie & Della

each a pritty box.

Expect to recieve my book on Monday

SATURDAY 5
Weather - Spring in earnest,
Windows & doors all open.
Heavy rain at night that made sad work for us
Mr Grey spent the night with us,
SUNDAY 6
Weather - a dark, wet rainy Sabbath.
Does God blame us when we cannot serve
Him as we ought do?

Lillie & Della spent the night away

Monday April 7, 1873
Weather - quite pleasent. Bought another concert ticket and I am going to give that to mother
Tuesday 8
Weather - snow, wind and rain. The order of the day. Papa had a paper from Uncle Augustus. My book did not come
Wednesday 9
Weather, more snow. Sang to Mr. Perkins "Our Golden Song - Whatever is right" Concert unclearunclear

Thursday, April 10, 1873
Weather - pleasant
Bella had a present of a nice pair of kid gloves. Mother and the girls went to the "Old Folks Concert"
Friday 11
Weather - pleasant but unclear showers. Another book from the library. Had a call from Mis unclear unclear Don't see why the "Silver Song" doesn't come
Saturday 12
Weather - bright and pleasant
Wrote my new hymn "Come at the Call" Tasted some unclear bread Mr. Wiley left us to be gone three weeks.

Sunday, April 13, 1873
Weather - mild and pleasant. A beautiful Sabbath. My "Star of Glory" was sung by unclear Church choir this morning. God gives me blessings that I do not deserve. 
Monday 14
Weather. Pleasant. Heard from Mr Perkins. He paid me a high compliment but wants no more Hymns at present. sent my unclear to Mr Abbey
Tuesday 15
Weather More rain which unclear of nice. Wrote to H.S. Perkins. Hope he will let me write songs for him if not religious effort. Papa found a handsome sleeve-button.

Wednesday, April 16, 1873
Weather - chilly and somewhat rainy. Lillie received a letter from Mr Wiley. Wrote to Mr Whitney about my "Silver Song" which has not come unclear In trust a good story
Thursday 17
Weather - snow snow and more rain. Going to make a bold effort to get out to church if God favors it, I shall succeed. Another book from tthe Library
Friday 18
Weather - still wet and raining. Heard from Mr Perkins. he gives a chance to write songss for him and sent a leter of introduction to J.H. unclear Georgetown_Mass

Saturday, April 19
Weather. Very pleasent. 
Heard from Mr. Whitney. unclear I unclear unclear my "Silver Songs"
Sunday 20
A Splendid Sabbath. 
I've had calls from Mr. Haston. Mr Grey. Mellie V. Carrie Clark. Mother heard a lecture on Spiritualism. 
Monday 21
Weather. More snow. unclear night. Wrote to Mr unclear I got my Hymn ready to send to him in the morning

Tuesday, April 22, 1873
Weather - rather stormy. Sent my Hymns "Song of Praise" to unclear. Wrote to Mr Perkins. Father at home, having a rest
Wednesday 23
Weather - pleasant but cold. Mrs. Orton called on me. She is going to interest herself in my carriage unclear. I know that God will reward her for this Christian act
Thursday 24
Weather - a snow storm. Mr Wiley came home quite unexpectedly. heard from Mr Abbey more promises. "Songs for the Bible" to be out this 1st of May.

Friday, April 25, 1873
Weather. Still unpleasant. Wrote a short letter. Father brought me home a unclear and a kind word from Mr Bliss
Saturday 26
Weather. Pleasant. Wrote to Mrs. Orton. Got-out Della's Sabbath School Lesson. Next Thursday is the 1st of May and Della is going to have a week's vacation. 
Sunday 27
Weather. A pleasant Sabbath. Sent one of my pieces of music to Mrs. Orton. Committed to memory the four last verses of the eighth chapter of Romans.

Monday, April 28, 1873
Weather. Not very pleasant. Received a letter from Uncle August. And also the catalog I sent for last Thursday. Uncle August is going to send us a box very soon.  
Tuesday 29
Weather - pleasant. Heard from Mr Tenney.  He accepted my song of Rain and sent me my price. Mrs. Harwood spent the day with us. 
Wednesday 30
Weather - pleasant. Sent for my "Silver Song" again. Hope I shall not loose it this time. Sent my letter to Aunt Kitten Tomorow is the first of May.

Thursday, May 1, 1873
Weather - A rainy morning
Della copied a piece for me. Did some copying a hard thunderstorm at night. Wrote to Mr. Tenning
Friday 2
Weather still unpleasant
Hope I will recive my book tomorrow, finished my song that I am going to send away tomorrow
Saturday 3
Weather. Clear and pleasant. 
Georgie Winter spend the day with Della. Received my long expected Silver Song that unclear unclear seventy unclear.

SUNDAY, MAY 4, 1873.
Weather--a May Sabbath, being warm + beautiful. "Praise God from whom all blessings flow." Had company to dinner.
MONDAY 5
Weather--still pleasant. Recieved my little Hymn Book from New York. Sent my song, "Our Jessie" to Mr Perkins.
TUESDAY 6
Weather--pleasant, but cloudy. Father recieved a unclear from Aunt Lucy. Lillie has a unclear upon the last week of her maidenhood.

WEDNESDAY, MAY 7, 1873.
Weather Rainy. Received a call from Mrs. Oplon? and I am to have my carraige to-morrow night: God bless my parents, sisters + friends, one + all.
THURSDAY 8
Weather unpleasant. Recieved my chair as a present from 17 of my lady friends. An eventful day for me.
FRIDAY 9
Weather Rained all day. Mr. Riley? Went away and will return to-morrow night: can use my chair in the house nicely.

SATURDAY, MAY 10, 1873.
Weather--pleasant.
Delba took me over to Madison St. How I shall prize my chair. Lillie is to be married Monday night.
SUNDAY 11
Weather a beautiful Sabbath. Did not go to church as I expected to. Hope I shall to able to go soon, now that I have my beautiful Chair.
MONDAY 12
Weather--warm + bright, Lillie's bridal day. The new couple have warmest congratulation. Their future happiness.

Tuesday, May 13, 1873.
Weather pleasant. The bridal couple. ____ book from the Library. Have not reveived a letter
for two weeks.
Wednesday 14
Weather cool and cloudy, Wrote to Whittney and also thus of my acknowledgements. Another Eager from Saint-Lucy.
Tuesday 15
Weather quite cold. Wrote to Mr. Abbey. Which I hope will bring me some money.
Mothers  birth-day.

Friday, May 16, 1873.
Weather cool & cloudy.
recieved a kind call from Mrs Orton.
The more I use my chair the greater I become attached to it.
Saturday 17
Weather _ quite warmer.
Father's birth-day, Heard from Mr Perkins.
Half od my acknowledge-
ments are completed.
Sunday 18
Weather_ a pleasant Sabbath,
Father took me to Jefferson Park for the first time. I enjoyed my ride, but had much
rather gone to Church.
Our Church occupies their
new basement to-day.

Monday, May 19, 1873.
Weather. Rained all day.
Where are we goint to have
pleasant weather.
Expected to hear from
Whitney but did not.
Tuesday 20
Weather. Cloudy but pleasant
Father took me to a nice ride
towards evening.
Think more & more of my
"Chair"
Wednesday 21
Weather. Pleasant,
Heard from Whitney.
"Songs of the Bible" is out,
Thunder-storm at night

Thursday, May 22, 1873
Weather_ pleasant, wrote two
more of my acknowledgements
one more to write Della has been selected as one of the 1,000
children who are to sing at the
Peace Jubilee next month.
Friday 23
Weather_ pleasant
Lillie recieved a kind
letter ____ Kittie
One week from to-day
is_
"Decoration Day"
Saturday 24
Weather- warm & bright Wrote
my last acknowledgement.
No one can realise, but myself,
what a blessing these seventeen
ladies have afforded me.
May God reward them all.

Sunday, May 25, 1873.
Weather_ a pleasant Sabbath,
Went to church with my chair
for the first times in compagny
with Della. We heard West Lewis 
_____.
Monday 26
Weather had a heavy shower &
high winds Another bood from
the Library "Marcie Warland"
Mr Gray paid us a short visit
Tuesday 27
Weather _ Pleasant. Sister _____
marraige notice appeared in
to-day's "Tribune"

Wednesday, May 28, 1873.
Weather_warm sent my letter to
Horace Waters & Son. Sent also for
my book:
"Heavenly Echoes"
Della went to a 
reheasal at the Centenary Church.
Thursday 29
Weather_ warm, & then cool.
Della took me to my first
morning ride, before breakfast
Next Tuesday is her birth-day
14 years.
Friday 30
Weather_ pleasant but rather
cold
"Decoration Day"
Saw a company of soldiers, headed by a band on blus Island
Avenue.

Saturday, May 31, 1873
Weatehr_ Pleasant. Wrote to 
Abbey again which I hope
will bring my money Della 
attended another rehearsal.
Sunday, June 1
Weather a pleasant Sabbath
Went to church again in the
evening with Mother and 
Della. Heard a good sermon
from Rev. Dr. Ravlin.
Monday 2
Weather Pleasant have not
had a letter for sometime
Father and Della took one
to a grand ride in the
evening.

Tuesday, June 3, 1873.
Weather_ warm
Della's 14th birth-day.
received my "Heavenly Echoes"
Father had a letter from
uncle R.....
Our Boy on the way.
Wednesday 4
Weather_ still warm
recieved a letter from
H. Waters & Son, who gives me
a chance to write. Shall send
then an effort soon.
Tuesday 5
Weather_ Summer is ____
Copied one of my efforts. another
nice ride in the evening
What ablessing my Chair is.

Friday, June 6, 1873.
Weather warms
Mother and Lillie attended the Peace Jubilee
Dela sung with the 1.000 children selected from the Public Schools.
Saturday 7
Weather warms
recieved our long expected box from Uncle A.
It will help us all a great deal.
Sunday 8
Weather a pleasant sabbath
Did not go to church
I have had my box just one month

Monday, June 9, 1873
Weather pleasant
Hope I shall hear from Abbey this week.
Wrote to uncle Augustus
Tuesday 10
Weather pleasant,
A book from the Library.
Recieved a call from a Doctor & two ladies
Wednesday 11
Weather pleasant,
Wrote to Aunt Kittie about 
our family record
Went down on Halster Street, in the evening

Thursday, June 12, 1873.
Weather Pleasant.
Wrote to Horace Waters and Sons
Lillie is the bride of a month
Friday 13
Weather still pleasant.
Heard from Prof. Abbey.
He sent me $6.00 mother bought her a new shawl.
Saturday 14
Weather warms
brought my new ___ hat lent my chair to an invalid lady. 226 Walnut St

Sunday, June 15, 1873.
Weather a pleasant sabbath
Did not go to church. had a chair
Father Mother & Della attended the Peoria St Chaple
Monday 16
Weather very warm
recieved another token of Christain kindness from Mrs Orton.
Hope they will send my chair back before Sunday.
Tuesday 17
Weather warm day & clear
Sent my effort
"Come at the Call" to H. Waters & Son,
Mr Perkins look to be out in July

Wednesday, June 18, 1873
Weather a warm day
Wrote to Mrs S.F.Ortin and Mr. H.S Perkins
Hope I shall be able to attent the ____ church next Sunday
Thursday 19
Weather another hot dry day
Wrote to cousin Emiline about our family record.
Della soon to have her summer's vacation.
Friday 20
Weather still hot and dry.
need a good shower
recieved a letter from Mrs. Orton. Mr. Wiley left us for the country this morning

Saturday, June 21, 1873
Weather very warm.
Della had company to suffer.
Our anual sunday school picnic next saturday.
Sunday 22
Weather a very warm sabbath.
Attended the 1st Chruch with Father. "Welcome, welcome to the House of the Lord" Mrs Orton.
Heavy shower towards night
Monday 23
Summer is earnest Sent for my book:
"Songs of the Bible."

TUESDAY, JUNE 24, 1873. Weather-Summer Weather-Father brought home our lounger-Billie took along walk and Della pass for 2nd grade.  WEDNESDAY 25 Weather-warm and clear-Received my book Songs of the Bible-It came sooner than I expected and pleases me much.  THURSDAY 26  Summer weather-sent my letter to Murray which I hope will help me some-Received a letter from Cousin Soniline

Friday, June 27, 1873.
Weather - pleasant Much interested in a borrowed Book, - "Foul Play." Mother & the girls making preparations for to-morrow's pic-nic.
Saturday 28
Weather - beautiful Our S.S. Pic-nic to River Forest, to which they attended - Father, Mother & the girls. My hymn. "Come at the Corner?" rejected by Waters.
Sunday 29
Weather - two nice showers. Attended Sunday School at the First Church. They sang my hymn "Little Band"

Monday, June 30, 1873
Weather A pleasant day.
Della had compagny.
Georgie Winter Hope to hear from Mr. Murray. this week.
1/2 of the year goes out tonight
Tuesday, July 1
Weather more rain.
Lillie heard from Mr Wiley.
Father received hus usual paper from Uncle Augtus.
Wednesday 2
Weather Cloudy weather
Mr. Wiley came home to spend the 4th with us.
sent my long letter to Prof. Abbey.

Thursday, July 3, 1873.
Weather more rain.
Felt bad all day. not with:
standing my many blessings.
received a letter from Aunt Kittie.
Friday 4
"Our Glorious Fourth"
A gloomy day. with two heavy rains.
Took a short ride. Mrs Winter sent me a package of ____ cake.
Saturday 5
Weather a beautiful day.
A decided contrast from what it was yesterday.
No letter from Mr Murray get.

Sunday, July 6, 1873
Weather a cool pleasant sabbath
Did not go to church as I expected to do. Father quite unwell all day after his night's illnes.
Monday 7
A pleasant day. Received a letter from Prof. Perkins containing $2.00 for my song "Our Jessie"
Wrote to Uncle Agustus.
Tuesday 8
Pleasant weather. Tooke a nice ride and wrote two letters sent for the ____
a ______ Journal. sent uncle a my two letters.
Have had my chair 2 months

Wednesday, July 9, 1873
Weather- clear & bright. Began a long letter to Mr. Bliss. Received an unexpected letter from Mr. Abbez?. Expecting unclear soon.
Thursday 10
A cool, pleasant day. Spent the day with father on W. Madison St. Saw more of city life than I have for a long time. Enjoyed the day very much. Thanks to father's kindness and my dear, old chair.
Friday 11
A pleasant day. Received a short letter from Uncle Augustus. Received the balance of my invoice: 
"The night that Nellie died." from Whitney.

Saturday, July 12, 1873
Weather - Pleasant. Finished my long letter to Prof. Bliss. Sister unclear been married two months to-night.
Sunday 13
Weather. Two nice rains. attended Church and Sunday School. Had an introduction to E.E. unclear. Heard my hymn - Gospel Tidings.
6    Monday 14
Weather- very warm day. Rec'd. my Unclear Almanac. Gave a copy of my Song to Miss Fannie Gibson.

Tuesday, July 15, 1873
Weather - mid-summer. One half of the summer months. Heard my song "Night that Nellie died" sung & played for the first time.
Wednesday 16
Warm weather. Received a letter from Mr. Murray - good news. He sent a me a list of musical writers. Copied? "Come at the ball"
Thursday 17
Another warm day.
Wrote a note of thanks to Mr. Murray. Copied & altered my old hymn "The Higher Rock"

Friday, July 18, 1873
Weather Pleasant. Sister Della had a call from Mattie Reed.
Going to sent two efforts away to moerow.
Saturday 19
Weather Pleasant with a nice rain. sent these efforts.
"Come at the call"
"The Higher Rock"
L.J.P Webster.
Elkoen Wis.
Sunday 20
A beautiful sabbath. Attended Church and Sunday School.
Heard Prof ____ preach. 
Heard Prof Bliss sing my 
Star of Glory

Monday, July 21, 1873
Weather warm
Mother bought her a pair of slippers.
Had a book from the library
Tuesday 22
A pleasant day. recieved a kind letter from Mr Pliss recieved a call from Mrs Orton.
She gave me an "Excursion Ticket"
Wrote to Mr Abbey & sent him a reciept for "Nellie"
Wednesday 23
Weather Warm but pleasant.
Wrote to New York about the River of Life.
Mother bought me a pair of suspenders.

Thursday, July 24, 1873.
Still warm. Began a letter to Prof. Bliss. Expect to go out on the lake tomorrow. Hope it will be a pleasant day.
Friday 25
A pleasant day. Attended an excursion to Highland Park. on the [illegible] "Muskegon" Enjoyed myself exceedingly. and wrote a piece of poetry on the grounds. 
Saturday 26
Still warm. Laila [?] brought home the [illegible] ocean which contained an editorial description of the excursion yesterday.

Sunday, July 27, 1873
A warm, sultry Sabbath. 
Did not go to church or Sunday School as I intended to.
Della quit unwell all day. 
Monday 28
Warm weather.
Recieved two letters and two "specimen pages" from the "River of Life."
Had a letter advertised in the "Evening Port."
Tuesday 29
Warm weather.
Recieved a letter with the song "Dying Girl" in in Mass [?] from Prof. Abbey
Hope to hear from Gluhorn this week.

Wednesday, July 30, 1873
A warm day. Della had company but was not home to recieve them
Recieved my "Inter-Ocean" to  chance with Mr. Webster - "bookfull."
Thursday 31
A rainy day. Wrote a letter did some copying. Going to make another effort towards getting something to do. 
Friday, August 1
Bleak and warm. Had a dreary hail storm in the afternoon.
Father took me down on the [illegible] in the evening.

Saturday, August 2, 1873.
Weather - pleasant.
Mr. Wilez returned from the country. Received a letter from Prof Perkins.
Going to Church to-morrow
Sunday 3
A beautiful Sabbath.
Clear, cool & breesy. Went to church and Sunday School. Heard a good sermon - text
St Matthew 10-39.
Monday 4
Recieved from Mr Tenney a "specimen of age" of his book "Golden Sunbeams."
It contains unclear
"Song of Praise"

Tuesday, August 5, 1873.
A nice day. Received a letter from Mr. Bliss.
Sent unclear hymns
"Our Golden Song"
"The Youthful Christian"
to G.E. Kimball
Wednesday 6
another nice day. Answered Mr. Bliss's letter.
Wonder if I will go to the excursion Friday.
Mrs Orton gave me a ticket Sunday.
Thursday 7
Still pleasent.
Wrote a new hymnal. Give me thy heart 
Have not written on effort before for a long while

Friday, August 8, 1873.
Weather - a rainy morning but a pleasant day. Did not attend the Excursion to High-land Park as I expected to.
Greatly disappointed but feel "Tis all for the best."
Saturday 9
A pleasant day
Della & I took supper wtih Mrs. Winter. We all except Lillie attended a Choir Concert in the evening at our Church
Sunday 10
A warm Sabbath. Attended Church & Sunday School. Heard an eloquent sermon from Rev. Minot Savage
Text - Acts 7-55-56

Monday, August 11, 1873.
Pleasant weather.
Wrote to Miss Riplez. Father bought me home some reading matter.
Tuesday 12
Still pleasant
Did not feel very well, but wrote to G.H. Tenney
Father brought home  unclear
"Favorite Poems."
Wednesday 13
A beautiful day.
Sister Della attended S.S. Pic-nic to Cranston.
Third pic-nic for her this season.

Thursday, August 14, 1873.
Another beautiful day.
Hread from Mr T.F. Seward - no chance with him.
Copied the "Sister's Fare-well"
Intend to send it away soon
Friday 15
Weather - not very pleasant.
Recieved a call from Miss Graves. She brought me a beautiful bunch of flowers.
"Crumbs swept up" from the Library.
Saturday 16
Beautiful weather. Wrote to Uncle Augustus.
How glad I am that I can enter the House of the Lord to-morrow

Sunday, August 17, 1873.
A beautiful Sabbath. 
Attended Church and Sunday School Heard an eloquent sermon Prof Strong.
Brought home a published sermon by Dr Goodwin.
Monday 18
A warm day
Saw Barnum's street parade with Mother & Della from Mrs Winters front porch.
Father brought me some flowers
Tuesday 19
Another warm day
Felt bad & discouraged all day. Don't think I commenced the week right yesterday

Wednesday, August 20, 1873.
A very warm day.
Mr Grey unclear to make us a short visit. Mr Wilez came in from the country. Received a call from Mrs Orton. Father went to Barnum's show in the evening
Thursday 21
August weather - Hot!
Mr Grey Mother & Della attended Barnum's Show in the evening
Havn't had a letter for a week.
Friday 22
Clear & hot.
Recieved the "River of life" from Ditsons & Ci. N.Y.
It came quite unexpectedly & places me in debt of 35 cts.

Saturday, August 23, 1873.
Still very warm
Wrote to Ditson & Co. Wrote my new hymn "He calleth you."
Father & Mr Gray attended the old Globe Theatre
Sunday 24
A very warm Sabbath.
Did not go to church - my devotions sadly interrupted, which made me feel bad.
Is God displeased at what we can not help?
Monday 25
August weather. Father quite unwell. Mr Wilez & Mr Grey left us. recieved a pamphlet from Cousin Andrew - a letter & a bill from Ditsons & Co
Sent 35 Cts to that unclear

Tuesday, August 26, 1873.
Weather - somewhat rainy.
Have not been out to ride for a week
This is the last week of Della's vacations
Wednesday 27
Weather - warm days & cool nights
Felt bad all day. Have not felt like myself for a long time. Oh that I were a better Christain
Thursday 28
A warm day
Wrote a letter. Got Della's S.S. Lesson out.
No permanent chang in my feelings

Friday, August 29, 1873.
Another warm day.
Felt bad all day. Sent my letter to Ditson & Co.
Nellie Clark took tea with us
Saturday 30
Warm weather
Afraid I have lost the 2 Hymns that I sent to Mr. H. E. Kimball. Don't think I shall go to church to-morrow
Sunday 31
Another warm Sabbath.
Still absent from church.
Did not feel worthy to enter the House of the Lord in my present state of feelings.
Dr Goodwin has returned

Monday, September 1, 1873.
A beautiful day for the 1st of Sept. Della began school as 2nd grade scholar Feel better & more cheerfull than I have for some time. I thank God & my faith in prayer.
Tuesday 2
Beautiful weather.
Wrote a short letter. Lillie disappointed in not hearing from Mr Wilez
Della had one of her new school books.
Wednesday 3
Weather - somewhat rainy.
Much interested in my book, - "Stepping Heavenward." A good book, full of Christain teachings.
Am I living as its author lived? Ok, no.

Thursday, September 4, 1873.
A breezey day.
Wrote a letter & took a nice ride.
Lillie heard from Mr Wilez.
Mother sent to bed very tired in deed. How I hate to see my dear parents work so hard.
Friday 5
Very pleasant.
Finished my book "Stepping Heavenward." It is truly a splendid work, but tI think some of its characters too highly dream.
Saturday 6
A pleasant day.
"Speck" died five years ago last Tuesday.
He deserves a place where the good dogs go.

Sunday, September 7, 1873.
A beautiful Sabbath.
Attended Communion & Sunday School.
Father & Mother heard Prof Irving at McVicker's Theatre.
Monday 8
Still pleasant.
Sent to Boston for some specimen pages. Father brought home some reading matter.
Della had her tooth taken out like a brave girl.
Tuesday 9
Still Pleasant.
Much interested in the "Silent Partner." No mail matter for me for over two weeks
Had my Chair four months

Wednesday, September 10, 1873.
A pleasant day.
Wrote to Mr Bliss.
After school, Della & one of her school mates took me to a nice ride
Thursday 11
A warm day. Father brought me a bouquett of flowers.
"Flowers speak of God above,
For they bear his touch of love,-
Tokens pure, & ever sweet
Softly blooming at our feet."
Eddie

Saturday, September 13, 1873.
Weather - clear & cool.
Received a letter from New York.
Recived my specimens & also a copy of the "Golden Sunbeam." from Lou & Shepherd.
Boston. Mass.
Sunday 14
A pleasant Sabbath.
Attended Church & Sunday School. 
Dr. Goodwin preached a good sermon on the "Grace of Giving."
Monday 15
Weather - a cool day.
Recieved a letter from an unexpected source. Hope to have another before long.

Thursday, September 16, 1873.
Still pleasant
Sent my Song in Miss - The Dying Girl," to
"I. Brainard's Sons",
Cleveland, Ohio
Wednesday 17
Warm with a very high wind.
Had a big fire on the west side, which made us all think of "The Great Fire" about two years ago.
Thursday 18
Clowdy weather.
Wrote a letter
Sister Lillie will soon have a home of her own.
"Aunt Jane's Hero" is a beautiful book.

Friday, September 19, 1873.
Cool - clear - pleasant.
Received a letter.
"S. Brainard & Songs" returned the "Dying Girl." Father began taking the "Times"
Read two good Sermons.
Saturday 20
Very pleasant.
Sister Lillie begins house keeping to-day.
Not going to morrow to church - my chair being out of order.
Sunday 21
A September Sabbath - mild & pleasant. Spent its hours at home. Why has God given me this rebellous heart that such little things trouble me so? May He pity & love me still.

Monday, September 22, 1873.
Very pleasant. Mother & Della took a long tramp for me.
Another book from the Library. The Autumn season begins today.
Farewell, sweet Summer.
Tuesday 23
A nice day. Recieved a kind letter from Mr Bliss--fixed my chair - & took supper with sister Lillie.
"The Exposition" opens on Thursday.
Wednesday 24
Weather - rain - rain.
Wrote a letter
Have not had a ride for a long time.

Thursday, September 25, 1873.
A pleasant day Sent away two letters - Mr Doane & Rev. R. Lowry. Hope it will get me something to do.
Exposition opens to-night
Friday 26
A warm day - high winds.
Father at home painting.
The financial sky looks dark - not for poor me, but for the men of the world.
Recieved our "Eagle"
Saturday 27
Summer again - pleasant but very warm.
Sister Della painted her own room. making it look quite nicely

Sunday, September 28, 1873.
A gloomy Sabbath - rained all day. Read one of Morrises Sermons. Committed to memory these 3 verses 16-17-18 from 14 Chap of Romans
A sermon in themselves.
Monday 29
After the storm - clean & pleasant. Took a nice ride - thanks to Sister Della. Recieved a call from Mrs Orton.
"Aurora Floyd" from the Library.
Tuesday 30
Still pleasant. Della had quite a fall at school.
Began a letter to Mrs Orton
"Aurora Floyd" a great book.

Wednesday, October 1, 1873.
Pleasant. Sent 30 cts to "Lee & Shepard" for "Golden Sunbeams."
Received a letter from Mr Lowry.
A ray of hope in the distance.
Thursday 2
A beautiful day.
Wrote a business letter.
Much interested in my Library book
13 more Sabbaths in this year.
Friday 3
Weather - more rains.
A stormy night. Della had company. 
Mr Wiley came in from the country.

Saturday, October 4, 1873.
Cloudy, but pleasant.
Sent my letter to New York, which I hope will come to something.
Mrs Orton sent me a package of good reading.
Sunday 5
A cool, cloudy Sabbath.
Mother & Della took me to the "Temple Baptist Church." in the evening.
Heard a good sermon, - with good singing.
Monday 6
Still cold & cloudy.
Another book from the Library.
Mother took Della's dress to have it colored.

Tuesday, October 7, 1873.
A beautiful day.
Wrote a little & read some.
Looking for a letter from New York this week
Wednesday 8
Another beautiful day.
Recieved a letter from Mr. Doane - no hopes from that quater.
Della had a letter from Green Bay Wis
Thursday 9
A beautiful day.
Celebrated our Second Fire Anniversary by taking a nice ride.
Father not feeling very well.

Friday, October 10, 1873.
"Indian Summer" - mild & misty.
"Lee & Shepard," Boston, sent me another copy of their -
"Golden Sunbeams"
Saturday 11
Still very pleasant.
Mother & the girls attended the "Exposition."
No letter from New York yet.
Sunday 12
An Autumn Sabbath - mildly pleasant. Attended Church & Sunday School. Dr Goodwin's subject was the
"Promise of the Ressurrection"
It was an excellent effort.

Monday, October 13, 1873.
Pleasant - with a high wind.
Recieved a returned letter from Washington. 
No news from N. York as yet. "Charity night" at the Exposition.
Tuesday 14
Indain summer
Lillie rec'd a letter from Mr Wiley
Am getting discouraged about hearing from N.Y.
Wednesday 15
Still very pleasant.
Spent an unhappy day - sad thoughts are my portion in life.
God pity & love me still.

Thursday, October 16, 1873.
Weather - dark & cloudy.
Began a letter to Mr Abbey. read some. Felt discouraged, but tried to be cheerful.
Friday 17
Dark, cloudy weather.
A rainy October night. Good news from N.Y. - God has called me once more into His service, unworthy as I am. May I labor in the right spirit.
8 Saturday 18
Pleasant after the storm.
Della attended the Expositions" again.
Wrote my new hymn - 
"What is a tear?"

Sunday, October 19, 1873.
A beautiful Sabbath.
Mother & the girls took me to the "Temple Baptist Church" in the evening.
A good sermon, but rather loudly delivered
Monday 20
Pleasant, but cool
Had a little flurry of snow. High winds at night.
Della did some copying for me in the evening.
Tuesday 21
An Autumn day - cold & windy.
Wrote a letter to Biglow & Main. Father bought me some writing paper

Wednesday, October 22, 1873.
Pleasant, but cold.
Copied one of my hymns.
Going to send three Efforts to New-York soon
Mother most sick with a hard cold.
Thursday 23
A fall day - cool.
Copied 2 hymns.
Della thinks I can go to the Exposition Saturday.
Friday 24
Mild & pleasant.
Rec'ed another kindness from Mrs Orton. God reward her, & Mother & Della too, for what they are doing for me.

Saturday, October 25, 1873.
A beautiful day. Did not go to the Exposition. Got my three efforts all ready to go out Monday morning.
Hope to attend Church to-morrow.
Sunday 26
A rainy Sabbath. Felt bad all day. Oh! that God would give me a more submissive heart.
"Lord, I beleive, - help thou any unbelief."
Monday 27
Cold & cloudy.
Sent 3 efforts:
"Come at the Call"
"Rock of my Refuge"
"What is a Tear?"
to "Biglow & Main"
N.Y.

Tuesday, October 28, 1873.
A snow-storm - with very high winds.
Expect to attend a Church entertainment next Thursday evening.
Wednesday 29
Weather - more snow.
Received a letter from Prof Abbey.
Poor father - how I wish I might help him more.
Thursday 30
Stormy weather. Attended an "Old Folk's Concert" at the Temple Baptist Church. Not much pleasure with the Entertainment. Mr Wiley brought me home.

Friday, October 31, 1873.
A cold day. Got a new hymn in my mind. Father brought me a picture paper.
The 27th of next month is Thanksgiving
Saturday, November 1
Clear & pleasant.
Wrote my new hymn - "Our Choices"
Della brought me a handsome picture from the Exposition.
Sunday 2
A stormy Sabbath. Felt unhappy all day.
"They think I am not a Christain,
Nor act a Christain's part;
They know not all the sorrow,
That weighs upon my heart."

Monday, November 3, 1873.
Clear & pleasant.
Recieved a Postal card from Biglow & Main, relative to my 3 efforts.
To-morrow is our local Election day.
Tuesday 4
Mild & pleasant.
Began a letter to Cousin Emeline. Miss Ripley called on us.
An oyster supper at our Church Thursday night.
Wednesday 5
Still pleasant.
Did a little copying. Oh! these thoughts of mine, - how troubling they are.
Feel bad about my Library book.

Thursday, November 6, 1873.
Beautiful weather.
Sent away my frist post card - think they are grand things.
Sister Della did me a kindness that I shall not forget very soon.
Friday 7
Rather rainy.
Mr Grey brought me some reading. He spent the evening with us.
Don't think Father does right about my book.
Saturday 8
A pleasant day. Mother & the girls went to the Exposition again. Della brought me 12 beautiful tracts.
Father heard from Uncle Augustus.

Sunday, November 9, 1873
A mild Sabbath. Attended Church & Sunday School. Hired a boy for the first time. An incident accurred at Sunday School, to be known only to God & this lone heart of mine.
Monday 10
Still pleasant Lillie rec'ed a letter from Mr Wiley.
Copied one of my efforts.
Still no Library book.
How can Father treat me so!
Tuesday 11
Cold, but pleasant. Lillie had company all day. Della's kitten met with an accident
My Library book returned.

Wednesday, November 12, 1873
Weather-snow of the ground this morning.  received a call from Mrs. Orton.  My shawl is to be forthcoming.  A book from the library once more.
Thursday, 13
Rather pleasant received a long letter from cousin Andrew. Hope to hear from New York soon.
Friday, 14
Weather sill pleasant.  Father received his eagle.  Would like to hear Newman Hall tonight.

Wednesday, December 3, 1873
Lovely weather - more rain. 
Took supper with Sister Lillie. Della had company in the evening.
Had one of my thinking days - wish they woulld not come so often.
Thursday 4
A cold day. Father recieved a letter & a little box from (?) Augustus - both of which were very acceptable.
Don't think we shall move after all.
Friday 5
Weather - pleasant, & warmer.
Wrote to (?) Augustus "of the 8 of 3" from the Library.
Della won't have to do this much longer.

Saturday, December 6, 1873
Rather pleasant. Much interested in "The Spy".
Don't expect to go out to-morrow.
Felt down, particular(?) at night
Sunday, 7
An unpleasant Sabbath - snow & slush. Della sung with the Church Choir at the Paoria(?) St Chapel.
Wanted to attend, but could not, of course.
Monday 9
A wet rainy day.
Do hope I shall hear from Biglow & Main before Saturday night.
"More purity give me,
"More strivings within."
Bliss.

Tuesday, December 9, 1873
A pleasant day. Rec'd my letter from Biglow & Main, who acccept 2 of my hymns & send me an order for $4.00. How good God is to me - how undeserving I am.
Wednesday 10
Mild, but cloudy weather.
Mr Willy presented my order & brought me my money at night. 
Think it was very kind in him.
Father had company in the evening.
Thursday 11
Weather - rainy & unpleasant.
Wrote to "Biglow & Main." Della had her new shoes.
Glad I can help the dear girl some.

Sept 22 [nd?]
"Three Successful Girls."
Sept 29th
"Aurora Flozel"
Oct 6th
"bora and the doctor."
Oct 18th
"Madame's Secret."
Oct 22nd
"[Tancred?]"
Nov 12th
"Belgravi."
Nov 21st
Harper's Magazine Vol 46.
Dec 5th
"The Spy."

Dec 9th
"borneth of as a Flower"

MEMORANDA
Efforts written & altered
during the current year.
“Onward.”
“Drifting.”
“Harvest time”
“Walking on the Shore”
“Song for the Spring.”
“Our refuge”
“Our desire.” or
“The angels are calling.”
“Our Golden Song.”
“Song of Praise”
“Come at the Call.”
“The Higher Rock”
“Give me thy heart”
“He called [?]”
“Beautiful Home”
“Rock of my Refuge”
“What is a tear?”
“Our Chorus.” “Our Hymn”
“Our Missions.”
“Song of Trust”
